headline: Dr Reddy?s layoffs: Pharma major to cut workforce cost by 25%? Here's what the drugmaker says
intro: Dr Reddy's layoffs: The leading pharmaceutical major has denied ?factually incorrect? media reports claiming it plans to cut workforce costs by 25 per cent amid a downsizing initiative.
imagecaption: Dr Reddy?s layoffs: Dr Reddy's Laboratories has categorically denied media reports claiming that the drugmaker plans to trim its workforce costs by 25 per cent. IN PICTURE: Dr Reddy's Lab; Clicked by Bharath Sai

headline: Home remedy: Indian pharma bets on domestic brands to combat US generics slowdown
intro: Brand-heavy companies such as Mankind Pharma, Sun Pharma, Torrent Pharmaceuticals and Eris Lifesciences are expected to outperform their generics-heavy peers such as Cipla and Dr. Reddy?s in the near term, experts said, as the US generics market stares at a cyclical slowdown.
imagecaption: Brand-heavy companies are better positioned to justify their current valuations.

headline: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q2 Results: Net profit drops 9.5% to  ?1,342 crore on acquisition cost, revenue up 16.5% YoY
intro: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q2 Results: The drugmaker's total revenue from operations in the second quarter of current fiscal rose 16.5 per cent to  ?8,016 crore.
imagecaption: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q2 Results: Net profit dropped 9.5 per cent in the September quarter on weak US demand; Picture By Bharath Sai

headline: Buy or sell: Dr Reddy's to HCL Tech, Vaishali Parekh recommends three stocks to buy today ? 14 August
intro: Buy or sell stocks: Vaishali Parekh has recommended three stocks to buy today ?HCL Technologies, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, and TajGVK Hotels & Resorts.
imagecaption: Stock market today: Nifty 50 index has 24,000 zone as the crucial support, believes Vaishali Parekh of Prabhudas Lilladher.

headline: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q1 Results: Net profit drops 0.8% to  ?1,392 crore, revenue rises 14% YoY; stock split declared
intro: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q1 Results: The pharma major's revenue from operations in the first quarter of current fiscal rose 14 per cent to  ?7,672.7 crore
imagecaption: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q1 Results: Revenue rose 14 per cent in June quarter; Dr Reddy's Lab Picture By Bharath Sai

headline: New businesses and partnerships hold the key to Dr Reddy's growth
intro: With a crucial product in the US set to go off-patent in January 2026, the company has adopted a multi-pronged strategy comprising partnerships, acquisitions and new products to boost revenue.
imagecaption: Some analysts reckon DRL?s US revenue from gRevlimid may well have peaked in FY24. Photo: Bharath Sai/Mint

headline: Q4 results today: Dr Reddy's Labs, Voltas, JSW Energy, Pidilite Ind, United Breweries, and others to post earnings today
intro: Q4 FY2024 Results: Around 42 companies, including Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Voltas, JSW Energy, Pidilite Industries, United Breweries, IDFC, Hindustan Media Ventures, and PB Fintech, are scheduled to post their earnings on May 7.
imagecaption: Q4 FY2024 Earnings: Over 42 companies are expected to post their earnings today

headline: Dr. Reddy?s to promote and distribute Sanofi?s vaccine brands
intro: The tie-up gives DRL a stronger portfolio and takes it to second place among vaccine players in India.
imagecaption: The partnership will include well-established paediatric and adult vaccine brands such Hexaxim, Pentaxim, Tetraxim, Menactra, FluQuadri, Adacel and Avaxim 80U. Photo: Reuters

headline: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q3 Results: Net profit rises 10.6% to  ?1,379 crore; 5 key highlights
intro: Dr Reddy's Laboratories Q3 Results: The rise in profit was driven by higher market share in existing products in North America and growth in Europe.
imagecaption: Dr Reddy's Lab; Picture by Bharath Sai

headline: Nerivio: From price to efficacy, all you need to know about drug-free migraine treatment
intro: Dr Reddy's Laboratories introduced Nerivio, a wearable therapy device for migraine management. It has shown effectiveness in relieving pain and reducing the need for acute treatment drugs in nine out of 10 patients, the drug maker said.
imagecaption: 'Nerivioï¿½ is the first and only USFDA-approved device to use Remote Electrical Neuromodulation (REN) to prevent and treat migraine,' Dr Reddy?s Laboratories said in a press release.
